PARAGRAPH.STRING: (4,632 m) is a peak of the Monte Rosa massif in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland.
is the second highest peak of the massif, after the Dufourspitze (4,634 m), and the second highest summit in Switzerland.
The first ascent was by Christopher Smyth, James G. Smyth and E. Smyth in 1854. At the time it was unclear which was the higher summit — the Ostspitze or the neighbouring Dufourspitze.
The first traverse of the entire summit ridge (Grenzgipfel–

–Dufourspitze) was by Richard and William Pendlebury and Rev. Charles Taylor with guides Ferdinand Imseng, Gabriel Spechtenhauser and Giovanni Oberto in 1873. This party had made the ascent, earlier in the day, of the Macugnaga face.
